intro: Argostemma unifolium, commonly known as the single-leaved argostemma, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in cymes, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
